contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Iriki'''|入来町|Iriki-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Satsuma District, Kagoshima|Satsuma District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On October 12, 2004 Iriki was merged with the towns of [[Hiwaki, Kagoshima|Hiwaki]], [[Kedōin, Kagoshima|Kedōin]] and [[Tōgō, Kagoshima|Tōgō]], and the villages of [[Kamikoshiki, Kagoshima|Kamikoshiki]], [[Kashima, Kagoshima|Kashima]], [[Sato, Kagoshima|Sato]] and [[Shimokoshiki, Kagoshima|Shimokoshiki]], all from [[Satsuma District, Kagoshima|Satsuma District]], and the old city of [[Sendai, Kagoshima|Sendai]], to form the new city of [[Satsumasendai, Kagoshima|Satsumasendai]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 6,250 and the [[population density|density]] of 86.35 persons per km². The total area was 72.38 km². [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
